title: Authors and Citation
text: Bruno Rodrigues. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rodrigues B (2025). rixpress: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines Nix. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://b-rodrigues.github.io/rixpress/, https://github.com/b-rodrigues/rixpress/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rixpress: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix},   author = {Bruno Rodrigues},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://b-rodrigues.github.io/rixpress/},   url = {https://github.com/b-rodrigues/rixpress/}, }

what: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: R packages provides framework building multilanguage reproducible analytical pipelines leverarging Nix’s build automation capabilities. heavily inspired R package targets. builds upon rix package, provides helper function define reproducible development environments code using Nix ensuring pipeline runs fully reproducible Nix-managed environment. rixpress requires users write pipeline using familiar R code. example R script defines derivations (d0, …, d4 doc) passed rixpress(): Running rixpress(rxp_list) generates pipeline.nix file, contains build instructions derivations final outputs Nix code. possible define derivation runs Python code well. build pipeline run: build process assumes presence default.nix file defines computational environment pipeline runs ; default.nix file can generated using rix package. default.nix defines environment R, R packages, Quarto, required system-level dependencies pinned specific date ensure reproducibility. example , first derivation loads mtcars.csv (actually .psv file, since data separated pipes –|… ? just –). output (e.g., mtcars, mtcars_am, mtcars_head, mtcars_tail, mtcars_mpg, page) built Nix within environment defined default.nix file. Concretely, rix made using Nix package manager easier R users, rixpress makes now easy use Nix build automation tool! run rixpress(rxp_list), folder called _rixpress/ gets also generated contains file JSON representation pipeline’s DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph). can visualize pipeline using plot_dag(): DAG pipeline built using Nix, outputs get store -called Nix store /nix/store. can annoying retrieve objects Nix store rixpress contains several helper functions: rxp_read("mtcars_mpg") reads mtcars_mpg memory; rxp_load("mtcars_mpg") loads global environment. complex outputs documents, (example Quarto document defined , called page), rxp_read("page") returns file path, can open browseURL("path//page"), can copy outputs /nix/store/ current worknig directory using rxp_copy("page"), read . can export cache file easily import another machine (CI) avoid rebuild everything scratch using export_nix_archive() import_nix_archive() respectively.
code: library(rixpress)  d0 <- rxp_file(mtcars, 'mtcars.csv', \(x) (read.csv(file = x, sep = "|"))) d1 <- rxp_r(mtcars_am, filter(mtcars, am == 1)) d2 <- rxp_r(mtcars_head, head(mtcars_am)) d3 <- rxp_r(mtcars_tail, tail(mtcars_head)) d4 <- rxp_r(mtcars_mpg, select(mtcars_tail, mpg)) doc <- rxp_quarto(page, "page.qmd")  rxp_list <- list(d0, d1, d2, d3, d4, doc)  rixpress(rxp_list) rxp_make() plot_dag()

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: goal create data analysis pipelines : Fully Reproducible: Work way across machines time. Multi-Language: Allow steps R, Python (planned), languages supported Nix. Inspired targets: Mimic dependency tracking task orchestration, enhanced Nix’s deterministic builds. combining Nix’s reproducibility targets-like structure, can rebuild every step analysis—data processing, modeling, reporting—exactly intended, even years later different systems (long sources stay available systems supported Nix course).

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: rix package creates default.nix file specifying software environment (e.g., R version, packages). environment can used traditional interactive data analysis. rixpress generates pipeline.nix builds (potentially) polyglott data science project using Nix build automation tool. default.nix generated rix used provide right environment pipeline.

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: Define steps (derivations) pipeline.nix file, can use R languages. derivation produces outputs like datasets reports.

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: dag.json file maps relationships derivations. R scripts process JSON add correct dependency loading pipeline.nix.

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: Run rxp_make() execute pipeline, storing outputs Nix store (e.g., /nix/store/...). Easily recover outputs current R session using rxp_read() rxp_lead().

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: Complete Reproducibility: Pins dependencies exact versions. Multi-Language Support: Unlike targets, ’s limited R. Isolation: step runs sandbox, avoiding system interference. Portability: Share Nix files, anyone Nix can rebuild work.

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: package borrows targets: Dependency Tracking: Ensures steps rerun inputs change. Modularity: Breaks workflows reusable steps. Automation: Executes tasks right order. Nix extends ideas beyond R cross-language, reproducible framework.

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: tbd

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: install package directly GitHub, use remotes R package:
code: # Install remotes if you don’t have it if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes")  # Install the package from GitHub remotes::install_github("b-rodrigues/rixpress")

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
code: # Create derivations d1 <- rxp_r(mtcars_am, filter(mtcars, am == 1)) d2 <- rxp_r(mtcars_head, head(mtcars_am))  # Collect into a list rxp_list <- list(d1, d2)  # Save or process further (e.g., generate pipeline.nix and dag.json)

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: builds derivations, producing outputs Nix store.

title: Build Reproducible Analytical Pipelines With Nix
text: TBD

title: Adjust Python import statements — adjust_imports
text: calling rixpress(), file containing Python import statements automatically generated inside _rixpress folder. example, numpy package needed, file include line like "import numpy". However, Python programmers often write "import numpy np" instead.

title: Adjust Python import statements — adjust_imports
Adjust Python import statements — adjust_imports
text: old_import character string representing import statement replaced. example, "import pillow". new_import character string representing new import statement replace . example, "PIL import Image".

title: Adjust Python import statements — adjust_imports
text: return value; function performs -place modifications files.

title: Adjust Python import statements — adjust_imports
text: cases, correct import statement entirely different. example, pillow package, generated file contain "import pillow", incorrect—Python code import PIL namespace instead, e.g., "PIL import Image". adjustments automated reliably, adjust_imports() function allows search replace import statements programmatically. reads file _rixpress folder, performs replacement, writes modified content back file.

title: Adjust Python import statements — adjust_imports
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ adjust_imports("import pillow", "from PIL import Image") } # }

what: Export Nix store paths to an archive — export_nix_archive
title: Export Nix store paths to an archive — export_nix_archive
text: Creates single archive file containing specified Nix store paths dependencies. archive can transferred another machine imported Nix store.

title: Export Nix store paths to an archive — export_nix_archive
Export Nix store paths to an archive — export_nix_archive
text: store_paths Character, defaults "_rixpress", folder holding result symlinks. archive_file Character, path archive, defaults "_rixpress/pipeline-outputs.nar"

what: Generate a DAG from a list of derivations — generate_dag
title: Generate a DAG from a list of derivations — generate_dag
text: Creates JSON representation directed acyclic graph (DAG) based dependencies derivations.

title: Generate a DAG from a list of derivations — generate_dag
Generate a DAG from a list of derivations — generate_dag
text: rxp_list list derivations, name snippet, output rxp_r(). output_file Path output JSON file. Defaults "_rixpress/dag.json".

title: Generate a DAG from a list of derivations — generate_dag
text: Writes JSON file representing DAG.

what: Import Nix store paths from an archive — import_nix_archive
title: Import Nix store paths from an archive — import_nix_archive
text: Imports store paths contained archive file local Nix store. Useful transferring built outputs machines.

title: Import Nix store paths from an archive — import_nix_archive
Import Nix store paths from an archive — import_nix_archive
text: archive_file Character, path archive, defaults "_rixpress/pipeline-outputs.nar"

what: Create a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) representing the pipeline — plot_dag
title: Create a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) representing the pipeline — plot_dag
text: Reads json DAG _rixpress/dag.json, uses {igraph} generate plot

title: Create a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) representing the pipeline — plot_dag
Create a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) representing the pipeline — plot_dag
text: json_path Character string specifying JSON file path. return_igraph Logical, defaults FALSE. underlying igraph object returned? can useful process plot using tools.

title: Create a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) representing the pipeline — plot_dag
text: None default, prints plot. return_igraph set TRUE, returns underlying igraph object.

title: Create a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) representing the pipeline — plot_dag

what: Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
title: Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
text: function generates pipeline.nix file based list derivation objects. derivation defines build step, rixpress() chains steps handles serialization conversion Python objects R objects (vice-versa). Derivations created rxp_r(), rxp_py() . default, pipeline also immedtiately generated, build process can postponed setting build FALSE. case, pipeline can built using rxp_make().

title: Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
text: derivs list derivation objects, object list five elements: - $name, character, name derivation - $snippet, character, nix code snippet build derivation - $type, character, can R, Python Quarto - $additional_files, character vector paths files make available build sandbox - $nix_env, character, path Nix environment build derivation single deriv output rxp_r(), rxp_quarto() rxp_py() function. project_path Path root project, typically "." build Logical, defaults TRUE. pipeline get built right generated? FALSE, can build pipeline later using rixpress()

title: Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
text: character string containing complete Nix code pipeline.nix file. string can written file passed another function processing.

title: Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
text: generated pipeline.nix expression includes: required imports environments, typically default.nix files generated rix package; correct handling interdependencies different derivations; serialization deserialization R Python objects, conversion objects passed one language another; correct loading R Python packages, extra functions needed build specific targets cases, due automatic handling Python packages, users might want change import statements. default , say, pandas needed build derivation, imported import pandas. However, Python programmers typically use import pandas pd. change automatic import statements, please refer adjust_imports().

title: Generate Nix Pipeline Code with a Generic Default Target — rixpress
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create derivation objects d1 <- rxp_r(mtcars_am, filter(mtcars, am == 1)) d2 <- rxp_r(mtcars_head, head(mtcars_am)) list_derivs <- list(d1, d2)  # Generate the pipeline code rixpress(derivs = list_derivs, project_path = ".", build = TRUE)  } # }

what: Generate the Nix derivation snippet for Python-R object transfer. — rxp_common_setup
title: Generate the Nix derivation snippet for Python-R object transfer. — rxp_common_setup
text: function constructs build_phase Nix derivation snippet based given parameters.

title: Generate the Nix derivation snippet for Python-R object transfer. — rxp_common_setup
Generate the Nix derivation snippet for Python-R object transfer. — rxp_common_setup
text: out_name Character, name derivation. expr_str Character, name object transferred. nix_env Character, path Nix environment file. direction Character, either "py2r" (Python R) "r2py" (R Python).

title: Generate the Nix derivation snippet for Python-R object transfer. — rxp_common_setup
text: list elements: name, snippet, type, additional_files, nix_env.

what: Copy derivations from Nix store to current working directory — rxp_copy
title: Copy derivations from Nix store to current working directory — rxp_copy
text: Nix builds derivation, output save "Nix store" located /nix/store/. Even though can import derivations current R session using rxp_read() rxp_load(), can useful copy outputs current working directory. especially useful Quarto documents, can one input, case html output.

title: Copy derivations from Nix store to current working directory — rxp_copy
Copy derivations from Nix store to current working directory — rxp_copy
text: derivation_name name derivation copy. empty, derivations copied.

title: Copy derivations from Nix store to current working directory — rxp_copy
text: Nothing, contents Nix store copied current working directory.

title: rxp_file_common — rxp_file_common
text: Creates Nix expression shared logic R Python file reading.

title: rxp_file_common — rxp_file_common
code: rxp_file_common(   out_name,   path,   nix_env,   build_phase,   type,   derivation_func,   library_ext )

title: rxp_file_common — rxp_file_common
text: out_name Character, name derivation string. path Character, file path (URL local) folder path. nix_env Character, path Nix environment file. build_phase Character, language-specific build phase script. type Character, type derivation ("rxp_r" "rxp_py"). derivation_func Character, Nix derivation function ("makeRDerivation" "makePyDerivation"). library_ext Character, library file extension ("R" "py").

title: rxp_file_common — rxp_file_common

what: Inspect the build result of a pipeline. — rxp_inspect
title: Inspect the build result of a pipeline. — rxp_inspect
text: Returns data frame four columns: - derivation: name derivation - build_success: whether build successful - path: path derivation Nix store - output: output, derivation built successfully. Empty outputs mean derivation built successfully. Several outputs single derivation possible.

title: Inspect the build result of a pipeline. — rxp_inspect
Inspect the build result of a pipeline. — rxp_inspect
text: data frame derivation names, build successful, paths /nix/store, build outputs.

Load a derivation's output into the global environment — rxp_load
text: derivation_name Character, name derivation.

title: Load a derivation's output into the global environment — rxp_load
text: None. derivation object assigned global environment name derivation_name.

text: name Symbol, name derivation. additional_files Character vector, additional files include. Custom functions must go script called "functions.R", additional files need accessible build process can named anything. nix_env Character, path Nix environment file, default "default.nix". expr R code generate expression.

text: list elements: name, name derivation, snippet, Nix boilerplate code, type, additional_files nix_env.

title: rxp_py Creates a Nix expression running a Python function — rxp_py
text: basic level, rxp_py(mtcars_am, "mtcars.filter(polars.col('') == 1)") equivalent mtcars_am = mtcars.filter(polars.col('') == 1). rxp_py()generates required Nix boilerplate output -called "derivation" Nix jargon. Nix derivation recipe defines create output (casemtcars_am`) including dependencies, build steps, output paths.

rxp_py_file — rxp_py_file
text: Creates Nix expression reads file (folder data) using Python.

title: rxp_py_file — rxp_py_file
code: rxp_py_file(   name,   path,   read_function,   nix_env = "default.nix",   copy_data_folder = FALSE )

title: rxp_py_file — rxp_py_file
text: name Symbol, name derivation. path Character, file path include (e.g., "data/mtcars.shp") folder path (e.g., "data"). See details. read_function Character, Python function read data, taking one argument (path). nix_env Character, path Nix environment file, default "default.nix". copy_data_folder Logical, TRUE entire folder copied recursively.

title: rxp_py_file — rxp_py_file
text: list name, snippet, type, nix_env.

title: rxp_py_file — rxp_py_file
text: three ways read data rixpress pipeline: first point directly file, example, rxp_r_file(mtcars, path = "data/mtcars.csv", read_function = read.csv). second way point file also include files "data/" folder (folder can called something else). needed data split several files, shapfile typically also needs files .shx .dbf files. , copy_data_folder must set TRUE. last way read data, point folder, use function recursively reads data. example rxp_py_file(many_csvs, path = "data", read_function = 'lambda x: pandas.read_csv(os.path.join(x, os.listdir(x)[0]), delimiter="|")') provided anonymous function read .csv file data/ folder.

code: rxp_r_file(   name,   path,   read_function,   nix_env = "default.nix",   copy_data_folder = FALSE )

title: rxp_r_file — rxp_r_file
text: name Symbol, name derivation. path Character, file path include (e.g., "data/mtcars.shp") folder path (e.g., "data"). See details. read_function Function, R function read data, taking one argument (path). nix_env Character, path Nix environment file, default "default.nix". copy_data_folder Logical, TRUE entire folder copied recursively.

title: rxp_r_file — rxp_r_file
text: list name, snippet, type, nix_env.

title: rxp_r_file — rxp_r_file
text: three ways read data rixpress pipeline: first point directly file, example, rxp_r_file(mtcars, path = "data/mtcars.csv", read_function = read.csv). second way point file also include files "data/" folder (folder can called something else). needed data split several files, shapfile typically also needs files .shx .dbf files. , copy_data_folder must set TRUE. last way read data, point folder, use function recursively reads data. example rxp_r_file(many_csvs, path = "data", read_function = \(x)(readr::read_csv(list.files(x, full.names = TRUE, pattern = ".csv$")))) provided anonymous function read .csv file data/ folder.
